alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Love; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 1:36AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Johnston, eastern Love, southeastern Carter and northwestern Marshall Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 136 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Marietta, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Madill, Tishomingo, Marietta, Dickson, Mannsville, Ravia, Thackerville, Lake Murray, Lebanon, Russett, northwestern Lake Texoma and Oakland. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 0 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
